perturbation.original_text: The  obligations of the Agent  pursuant to this  Agreement  (other than those set forth in  Sections  2(d),  8 and 9 hereof)  shall  terminate  upon the completion  or  termination  or  abandonment  of the Plan by the Company or upon termination  of the  Offering,  but in no event  later  than the date  (the "End Date") which is 45 days after the Closing  Date (as  hereinafter  defined).  All fees or  expenses  due to the Agent but  unpaid  will be payable to the Agent in next day funds at the earlier of the Closing  Date (as  hereinafter  defined) or the End Date.  In the event the  Offering is extended  beyond the End Date,  the Company, the MHC, the Bank and the Agent may agree to renew this Agreement under mutually acceptable terms.
perturbation.changed_text: The  obligations of the Agent  pursuant to this  Agreement  (other than those set forth in  Sections  2(d),  8 and 9 hereof)  shall  terminate  upon the completion  or  termination  or  abandonment  of the Plan by the Company or upon termination  of the  Offering,  but in no event  later  than the date  (the "End Date") which is 45 days after the Closing  Date (as  hereinafter  defined).  All fees or  expenses  due to the Agent but  unpaid  will be payable to the Agent in next day funds 90 days after the End Date.  In the event the  Offering is extended  beyond the End Date,  the Company, the MHC, the Bank and the Agent may agree to renew this Agreement under mutually acceptable terms.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in payment terms. Initially, fees were due on the Closing Date or End Date. Now, payment is stipulated for 90 days after the End Date, creating uncertainty about when payment is actually due.

perturbation.original_text: Whether  or not  the  Offering  is completed or the sale of the Shares by the Company is consummated,  the Company, the MHC and the Bank jointly and  severally  agree to pay or reimburse the Agent for the Company, the MHC and the Bank have agreed to reimburse the Agent for its out-of-pocket  expenses,  and its legal fees (as  specified in Section 2) and to indemnify the Agent against  certain claims or  liabilities,  including  certain liabilities  under the Securities Act, and will contribute to payments the Agent may be required to make in connection with any such claims or  liabilities;  and the fees set forth under Section 2. In the event the Company is unable to sell a minimum of 708,050  Shares,  the  Company,  the MHC and the Bank shall  promptly reimburse the Agent in accordance with Section 2 hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Whether  or not  the  Offering  is completed or the sale of the Shares by the Company is consummated,  the Company, the MHC and the Bank are not obligated to pay or reimburse the Agent for any expenses. In the event the Company is unable to sell a minimum of 708,050  Shares,  the  Company,  the MHC and the Bank shall  promptly reimburse the Agent in accordance with Section 2 hereof.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text introduces a direct contradiction regarding the reimbursement of the Agent's expenses. The original text specifies that the Company will reimburse the Agent. The modified text states that the Company is not obligated to reimburse any expenses, thus creating uncertainty about whether the agent will be reimbursed or not. This contradicts the original agreement and later sections stating there is reimbursement.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 11.  Termination.  The Agent may  terminate  this  Agreement by giving  the  notice  indicated  below in this  Section 11 at any time after this Agreement becomes effective as follows:

          (a)  In the  event  the  Company  fails to sell the  required  minimum                number of the Shares by _________,  2000, and in accordance  with                the provisions of the Plan or as required by the MHC Regulations,                and applicable law, this Agreement shall terminate upon refund by                the Company to each person who has  subscribed for or ordered any                of the Shares the full amount which it may
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 11.  Termination.  The Agent may  terminate  this  Agreement by giving  the  notice  indicated  below in this  Section 11 at any time after this Agreement becomes effective as follows:

          (a)  In the  event  the  Company  fails to sell the  required  minimum                number of the Shares by _________,  2000, and in accordance  with                the provisions of the Plan or as required by the MHC Regulations,                and applicable law, this Agreement shall terminate without refund by
the Company to each person who has  subscribed for or ordered any
of the Shares the full amount which it may
perturbation.explanation: The modified text introduces a contradiction regarding what happens if a minimum amount of shares is not sold. Originally, a refund was required. The modified contract says it will terminate without a refund.
